Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March 2012. Situated just 5 minutes stroll from Zoologischer Garten train station which gives you access to anywhere in Berlin and has a direct train link to the airport. The hotel itself is small and clean and the staff were superb on our visit and spoke excellent English. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheeses as well as cereals and fruits etc. The rooms are comfortable and were cleaned daily. The room also has a free a safe and having free Wi-Fi in the hotel is another bonus. The hotel is located close to Savignyplatz which has a number of bars/cafes and restaurants and would recommend the Dicke Wirtin bar for the selection of beers and local pub food. Travel around Berlin is another bonus and would recommend purchasing the welcome card ticket which gives you access to trains, trams and buses and also gives you up to 25% discount at a number of attractions and restaurants. The hotel itself doesn't have its own restaurant but you can use the sister hotel's restaurant, Knese, where as a resident of Astoria you get 10% discount or 25% with the welcome card. We felt completely safe walking in this area at all times and that included coming in at 1am from a night out. We booked direct with the hotel via its website as they did a number of offers ie stay for 4 nights and pay for 3 so it only cost us 240 euros for the 4 nights including breakfast instead of 320 (approx £200). We will definitely come back here on a return visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch27
Reviews.Content: The hotel Astoria is located just off of Kurfurstendam close to shopping and transit. The bus from the airport stops just at the corner, and the Ubahn (Ulanderstrasse is equally close. The Sbahn is a short 10min walk to Savignyplatz. There are good restaurants nearby. The rooms are located in two distinct parts requiring some stairs combined with two elevators. Our room was large by European standards and the Hotel Astoria was good value. Internet functioned well and the breakfast was good. Check in and check out were properly handled with no surprises. This hotel was a good find and we will certainly return to its charm and convienient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Carina H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2011 for five days. It was the first time I stayed in the Kurfuerstendamm area, which proved to be an ideal location. It was close to all public transports. Rooms were large, clean and beds comfortable. I found the hotel staff friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was surprisingly good, but the dining area a bit small. Just remember to inform the hotel that you want a non-smoking room, which we forgot. But but as professional as they are, they solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Something doesn't feel right about the reviews of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Godot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three night at this hotel recently. I'm pretty soft when it comes to rating hotels compared to most people, but the unusually persistent high review of this hotel seem way out of line to me. The facility is indeed reasonably well located near the central part of West Berlin, but the overally quality of the facility and the very obvious need for it to be remodeled and redecorated, seems to have escaped the notice of the average reviewer, and that just doesn't feel right to me. I've never, not once, made this claim before but it seems to me that the reviews of this facility may very well have been cooked. Obviously one should always view ratings (this one included) with a grain of salt because, with a little on-going effort, one could rather easily generate numerous good review to bury negative ones. I'm not a cynical person, but after giving the matter careful thought I decided to write this review a few minutes ago after reading in the New York Times that the going rate for writing a five star review is $5. In spite of its good location this hotel was in my opinion more of a two star facility badly in need of redecoration and updating. The elevator only stopped on half floors meaning that one always has to lug their luggage either up or down one flight of stairs. Our room was the European standard (a bit on the small side) and the bath room was especially small with a shower control overly intruding into the limited space within the shower stall. Most significantly, there is no air conditioning and the hotel location does not allow for good natural air flow. We were fortunately at the hotel during very mild weather but this could be a real problem when the weather is hot. The carpeting on the floors both in the hall and in our room was badly worn and somewhat stained and not particularly clean. Wood or stone or ceramic flooring rather than carpet are more standard flooring materials in European hotels. The breakfast buffet offered generous hours but the food was average at best. I've stayed in about ten other Berlin hotels and other than location would rate this hotel in the bottom 10% rather than the top 20% which seems to be to be the collective rating of this hotel on Trip Advisor, Expedia, and one other rating site I checked. In summary, call me nasty or just plain wrong, but if you book this hotel don't be surprised when you find that it simply does not live up to its reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Founders81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 of my friends and we had 4 person room. Room was not huge, but large enough. It was clean and quiet when windows were closed. The ventilation was not perfect as sole source of fresh air was in bathroom. Thus it got little stuffy in the room during night. Breakfast was good and staff friendly. I can gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: andand49
Reviews.Content: Astoria is a small hotel situated in quiet surroundings but just 5 - 10 minutes walk from great shopping in the area near Gedächtniskirche. In the other direction there are plenty of restaurants around Savignyplatz. The room I got was of medium size and well equipped for being in a 3 star hotel. The room was very clean and everything in good repair. The hotel is also very easy to find if you arrive to Berlin via Tegel airport. The bus X9 stops att Zoo Railway Station, from where it is only 5 minutes walk. I can definitely recommend this hotel if you can do without hotel bar and restaurant, but there is no risk of going hungry and thirsty. There are lots of bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gut”
Reviews.Author: bobmel
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel with spacious room, good sized bathroom (with full shower curtain) and good breakfast. Staff was excellent although could not direct us to the nearest laundromat which we had to find on our own. Location was very good for us- near to train station, some tourist sites, grocery and wine stores and some good restaurants. Shopping is close also if you are into that. One negative was charge for internet service which website had led us to believe was included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel at the price”
Reviews.Author: KarinaSch
Reviews.Content: We travel several times at year, and this hotel is definitely one of the best at its price. We booked through the hotel and got 3 days for the price of 2 days. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was great and the location was close to Bahnhoff Zoo. And the shower was the best ever in a hotel :) We had a big family room for 4 people. There were 2 regular beds and a sleeping-couch. The only issue we have was that the sleeping-couch was too hard and uncomfortable - a top madress would have been nice. This hotel gets our best recommendation!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauricgn
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in this nice hotel, located in the central area of Kurfustendamm. The room was spacious and the breakfast was good, with a reasonable choice of well prepared food. The staff was very helpful with me in any situation (thank you for the help about my missed luggage at Berlin airport!!) and I hope to be back soon again!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic. Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: LEN74
Reviews.Content: Superb location but rather dull. No personal touch. Standard.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel - does the basics well enough”
Reviews.Author: drsoong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in October 2010 for a conference. I'd come straight from Bruges where I stayed in a much posher hotel, so maybe my expectations may have been set high, but found the Astoria to be, well, not so posh. Actually there's not much wrong with it, but it just doesn't shine. Mainly it's the room - a slightly odd shape (long and thin) due to its location at the end of a corridor, without much floor space to put a suitcase and - for me the worst bit - a thin cabin-style bed with only a single, thin duvet not much bigger than the proverbial postage stamp. Also no tea/coffee in the room, which I just sort of expect nowadays, unless you're in a real budget place (which I don't think this falls into). But there's a nice LCD TV in the room with BBC World and CNBC for English language, plus some clever internet facilities which I didn't use because I bought in-room wifi access (at 12 Euro for 24 hours - you can buy 2 hours for 10 Euro, but that's clearly not worth it, or I think it's cheaper for lobby access - but really there's not much space to sit down there!). Staff were friendly and helpful though, particularly the chap who checked me in on the evening I arrived, who was happy to chat over my free beer at the bar (which I got as I'd booked via their website). Location I'm not so sure about as I really didn't have much chance to explore Berlin while at the conference unfortunately - though I got the impression the tourist sights were a bus / underground ride away (e.g., Brandenburg Gate, East Berlin). There were good shopping centres around the hotel, and we also went to a really nice Vietnamese restaurant within walking distance. Also the Zoological Gardens underground station is within 5 mins walk - a major interchange for most of the underground lines. But the station area itself seems to be a bit of a dodgy place to hang around, particularly at night. Didn't see any trouble, but it felt a bit uncomfortable. Breakfast was nice enough - a few choices of cereal, fruits, yogurts, cold meats / cheeses, breads, and a hot platter with bacon, scrambled and boiled eggs. Certainly enough to fill up on. Like I said, it's been a good enough place to stay and I can't really complain, but if I were to come back I would like to try a different place - hence my "no" to the question about recommending to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BuckyFriend
Reviews.Content: Hotel Astoria had very comfortableroom accomodations and the breakfast room was well appointed and the breakfast served was delightful A great way to stay in the western part of Berlin and yet convenient to get to sight seeing and move about the city

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel I ever stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: RoamingAround
Reviews.Content: The good: - The hotel is a pretty decent location next to Zoo Station. This is a good spot to stay if you are interested in taking tours, since many of the them leave from Zoo station. - The bed was comfy - The TV was new The bad: - The room had no A/C - Two mornings in a row, we were called by the front desk telling us that they wanted to come in a clean the room. Not fun when you are trying to sleep in. - The bathroom shower head was broken and the shower curtain was not heavy, so it continually was being sucked into your body. Not fun. - The furniture in the room was dated. All of the chairs in the room had stains on them. They were probably clean, but didn't look it. - The hotel safe charged you a Euro each time that you opened it. - The entire room really needs to be updated. The TV was new, and the bed was comfortable, but all of the other objects in the room need an update. - If you are visiting Berlin as a tourist, you will spend almost no time in the Western part of the city, so the location of this hotel is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff and modest price”
Reviews.Author: zappa5
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Kurfurstendamm and Zooologisher Garten train/metro station. 3* hotel with clean average room and ok beds. Modest room price, with ok breakfast included. Was a bit hot without airconditioning. Nice and helpful staff. We had a pleasant stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Minttuinen
Reviews.Content: Really close to Bahnhof Zoo, with good connections everywhere with train and underground. Supermarket nearby open everyday until 10 pm. Hotel was very clean, bed comfy and good shower. Big room with big window. Staff really nice and helpful! Very good breakfast with lots of variety, included in price. Good way to start the day. Would defenately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SisselNorway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Berlin to have a nice, long weekend - in fact five days :-) We were very satisfied with the hotel. Big, nice room and bathroom with bathing tube, clean and tidy. The breakfast was good, and serving staff efficient. Great location, and very nice staff. When we bought flowers they provided a wase immidiately, even if it was late in the evening. As others has mentioned here before, the prices on the mini bar is rather high, and there are no coffee making facilities, but as we had read this here before we left home, we brought our own little travel water heater and a little bottle of cognac and was self-supplied. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worcesterdaisy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Astoria and would not hesitate to recommend it. It is well located, near to the Zoologischer Garten station and also near plenty of good shops and restaurants. The room we had - a triple - was spacious and very clean with a well-appointed modern bathroom. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier. All in all a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant cental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: icarey
Reviews.Content: We are just back and stayed at this hotel for four nights. The rooms are big and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Take the 100 bus at Zoo which takes you into town with only a few stops. The 72 hour tourist travel pass for €22.00 was also a great idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HeyNO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Astoria for 3 nights and loved it. The staff were helpful with restaurants and sight seeing. It is located 2 blocks from the Zoo and Aquarium and good shopping area. Good breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: saab96
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent, with short distance to Zoo U and S-Bahn station. Also shopping street Kurfursterdamn is very near. Our room was clean and well equipped. No AC in the room, but at the October it did not matter. Some street noise was coming to the room, but not too much. Staff of the hotel were really friendly and nice. The breakfast of the hotel was very good and there were lof of choices. I would recommend this hotel to visitor of Berlin and when we go again to Berling I think we will book the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm42
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights -ideal location being so near Zoo station for links all over Berlin and some good restaurants-check out Cafe Art down the road . Staff very friendly and helpful at recption and in breakfast room .Rooms comfortable and nice size though agree with previous posts that it could get hot and lack of airconditioning only defect. No hidden frills but good basic comfort -yep would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Location great, facility a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: Gigrace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great spot to get the buses and trains. No air conditioning (the desk did provide a floor fan), antique elevator, difficult to use safe and room key. Breakfast which was included was good. No ice vending machine; had to ask desk several times to obtain ice. Noisy as we had to have the window open to cool the room down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: KMTravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel made it easy to use public transportation in Berlin. It is close to bus stops and the Metro. We bought a 72 hour pass that gave us access to busses and underground trains. The Express bus from the airport drops you just a couple blocks from the hotel and the underground located in the same area takes you to the convention center / MESSE (or many other sites). The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was good. There was a nice deck outside our window, so we could relax outdoors. The room was no frills, but we didn't spend much time in it. My only complaint was the shower. It had trouble mixing the hot and cold water.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very helpful staff but no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: craghopper
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location near the Zoo Station S-Bahn and less than 10 mins walk to the Uhlandstrasse U-Bahn. The neighbourhood has plenty of bars and restaurants and it's a short walk to Sauvignyplatz where there are plenty more dining options. The hotel reception staff were very helpful and solicitous. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The main issue I had is that there is no air conditioning nor fan ventilation in the rooms, so you have to open the windows. Many of the rooms face the street which although quiet is adjacent to a main road that has 24 hour traffic with police and ambulances going past which necessitated the use of earplugs to get a good rest. Breakfast is adequate although unexciting. Good coffee though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: aminal100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early August. We got a reasonable price (including breakfast) by booking with the early-bird discount offered on the hotel's website. We took the X9 bus from Tegel airport (2.10 euro) to Zoologischer Garten station (about a 20 min trip), and walked about 5 mins to the hotel. The room was quite large and well equipped. There was no ac, but the weather in Berlin was perfect while we were there, so opening the window kept the room relatively cool. The room safe asks you to put in 1 euro, but you can get a key from the front desk that locks inside the safe so you can use it for free. They also have a laptop at the front desk that you can borrow to check mail, etc. Breakfast lasts from 6.30-10.30am and is excellent! It's quite a large spread with choices from several types of cereal (muesli to the chocolate kind children like), different flavors of yogurt, fruit (fresh as well as in syrup/juice), several types of bread, about 3 types of cheese, salami, bacon, boiled eggs, jams and preserves, nutella (!), juices, coffee, tea. The hotel is a perfect location for moving around and exploring Berlin. It is a 5 min walk to the Kurfurstendamm, and the proximity to the Zoo Station which has both the S and U Bahn is a definite bonus. The area also seems quite safe -- we came back after midnight a couple times (once at 3.30am) and had no worries about it. All in all, excellent value for money, a pleasant stay, and very clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, no 'buts' ...”
Reviews.Author: NomadRose3
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, the friendly staff, nice room. We booked walking tours for two days - the meeting place was at the train station just a block away. Furthermore, several good restaurants are a short walk away. I have no reservations about recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Catsarecute
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 wonderful days in Berlin. The hotel is close to the heart of Berlin and to all transportation. Everything about this little hotel is great. Even the price. However, it was very very warm in Berlin and air-condition would have been wonderful. The noise from the street and the trafic made it extremely difficult to have the windows open, but apart from that no complaints at all. Thanks to the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: SuzeQ1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Astoria has a great location near the Zoo Train Station. The room was large and the bathroom was large and updated. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were very good (and this hotel was the only one we stayed in where the breakfast included American style eggs and bacon.) We had a room on the second floor on the street and had no problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced three star in fairly quiet area”
Reviews.Author: mumbler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room which was comfortable and clean, all staff were polite and helpfull and made our short stay enjoyable. Small dining area but very adequate and tasty buffet breakfast. Three minute walk to U and S Bahns which make getting to the other side of the city very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Readybluedragon
Reviews.Content: This very ultra modern hotel is close to the Berlin Zoo, Zoological railway station, shops and restaurants. Everything is walking distance. You can walk to the station and catch a bus to East Berlin or pickup up the Original Berlin Walking Tour (of East Berlin) which we did to get ourselves orientated. Again, this hotel did not have air-conditioning (much the norm in mainland Europe) so the rooms and restaurant were warmish. The bedrooms were overly big but comfortable and quiet. Good sized bathrooms too. Lots of choices for breakfast too and very helpful and friendly staff. Free wi-fi too. The only criticism we had was that we had not locked the door properly one night using the second lock and in the middle of the night someone opened our door to our room but promptly shut it when they either realised it was the wrong room or someone was in bed. Not sure what happened here but it gave us a scare. Otherwise, you couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Around_the_World65
Reviews.Content: Astoria Hotel is a small family run hotel with excellent location on the elegant Fasanenstrasse in the western part of Berlin. It is literally only four minutes walk from Zoologischer Garten Train Station and about 8 minutes from Kurfürstendamm or Uhlandstrasse Underground stations. Staff is very nice and helpful and we felt very welcome during our three-night stay. As a party of four we had two double rooms. Ours was on top floor (fifth) and the room was spacious and very clean, from the crisp bed linen to the shiny bathroom. There was plenty of room for suitcases and a well stocked mini-bar made it possible to chill our own wine. There was a large flat screen TV, a desk, a table and two chairs and still plenty of room to move around. The only minuses were: a) The right bed (there were two separate beds put together) creaked enormously and every time my husband turned there was a terrible noise. b) The window could only be opened very little. This was a bit disappointing since we enjoyed very high summer temperatures during our stay, and - being on the top floor - the room was very warm at bedtime. Air conditioning is available but costs 10 Euro/day. The other couples double room was slightly smaller than ours but instead had a larger bathroom with a bathtub. It also had a balcony which gave them a better chance to let in fresh air in a warm room. Breakfast was good and buffet style with coffee/tea, yoghurt, orange juice, boiled and scambled eggs, bacon, bread rolls, toast, cereals and fresh fruit. Very nice. In all a very nice and well located hotel. We had three lovely days in this wonderful city and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyWhoLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor, we decided to book the hotel for a 5 night stay for our family (2 adults and to children aged 11 and 14) through Expedia. As many previous reviewers, we had a very pleasant and lovely stay! All our requirements were fulfilled by choosing the hotel - location was very central for both shopping and a central point for train, tram and busses. If you ask us, there's no need to pay for a "hop on and off" sightseeing tour as you will easily go by bus 100 and 200 as well. The room was big, nice furniture, lovely bathroom and best of all, everything was clean. We had some difficulties with regard to the safe box but this was handled smoothly. The breakfast was good and provided both healthy and unhealthly food! Eventhough, the hotel seemed to be fully booked some of the days we did'nt have to wait in line for a table. Also, it should be mentioned that the receptionists were very helpful and serviceminded. Only negative is that you have to pay 12,50 euro per day if you would like to have internet access at your room, however, you can ask to borrow a laptop in the reception and do the search you need for free. A stay at Astoria is really worth recommending and we will definently stay here again next time we go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A warning: Looks great but we were moved to sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spencerswood
Reviews.Content: Hard to write a review but I feel I must say that having researched and booked this hotel, on arrival we met the happiest man on this earth (see other reviews!) and he was happy to tell us that we were being moved to the sister hotel, the Berlin Plaza. OK, so we had a taxi and a drinks voucher but it was not what we expected. As it turns out, the Berlin Plaza is absolutely fine (see my other review) - possibly with some advantages - so I would not let this put you off booking - whichever hotel you end up at!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler, I felt very safe at the Hotel Astoria. Located 2 blocks from Zoo Station, the hotel was actually in a quiet area. The hotel is small with only 32 rooms and I think that contributes to the family atmosphere at this hotel. Everyone who worked at the hotel were extremely friendly and polite. The front desk reception was outstanding with suggestions and helpful hints. I had a double room and I was glad because it gave me a little more room to spread out. The breakfast was good with both hot and cold items. I especially liked the coffee because it was nice and strong. Breakfast is from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. I liked the early start to the breakfast buffet so I could get an early start sightseeing. I took either the 100 or the 200 bus to get everywhere I needed to go. I preferred riding the bus because it was more scenic than taking the U-Bahn. You can take the bus from the airport for 2.10 Euro. The bus will leave you off at Zoo Station and it is just a short walk to the Hotel Astoria. It is very doable with wheeled luggage - no hills or steps involved. I took a taxi ordered by the hotel for my return trip to the airport and it was 14.20 Euro - reasonable cost and the taxi driver was early and very professional. If you want to go to the top of the Reichstag, get there at 8 a.m. before the crowds. You have to go through security and that slows the line down. I found Berliners very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel is not air conditioned so it might be a problem in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great Christmas in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: wotton-under-edge
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in two rooms in December 2008 and it was great. Despite the fall in the purchasing power of sterling, I thought the rooms were good value. We had one double with shower and one twin with bath. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. No kettle (we are heavy tea-drinkers) but a minibar. Free breakfast was included in our package. There aren't that many tables, but as guests were coming down at different times we never had to wait long. Don't expect top quality food and service but we helped ourselves to plenty of fruit, egg, bacon, etc. Reception were very friendly and helfpul, and spoke good English. The location is excellent for tourists visiting Berlin, some attractions close by and a short walk from the zoo station with S Bahn, U Bahn and bus connections around the city. At the station we saw people drifting around the concourse a couple of times, but we had no trouble and the hotel street is quiet and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: EalingBlue
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant little hotel, handy for Zoo station, KuDamm, and the the various restaurants of Savigny Platz area. The staff were unfailingly polite, cheerful and helpful, and the rooms modern and clean. The only minor gripes would be the small breakfast area, best to avoid the 08.30 to 09.00 rush times, or you might have to wait for a table. Also, the beds were a bit firm and on the small side, especially if you are over 6ft - however, after a heavy days sightseeing, and an ample intake of Berlins famous hopitality, I slept like a log.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosie51cat
Reviews.Content: This is a fantasic hotel. The location is perfect .walking distance from the train station,just off the main shopping street.Although a busy area the traffic didn't bother us at all (good windows) that kept the traffic noise out. It is spotlesly clean,the rooms are a good size and the bathroom was very big. The breakfast was better than any I have had when been on city breaksand I have stayed in bigger hotels and paid a lot more money and got less than this hotel offers.The staff are very pleasent and helpful,There is in particular one member of staff I didnt get his name but he must be the happiest man alive he is lovely. Out of 5 I would give this hotel 5. Its great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stasya13
Reviews.Content: We spent holidays here. It is beautiful small hotel with very good location. It is situated in the center of the city. It takes about 7 minutes to get the railway station and underground station Zoo by feet. The room is spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet is very good (it's included hot and cold dishes). The staff is very helpful and kind. It is very nice hotel for reasonable prise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient; good breakfast;small room”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are still accurate; this is a friendly, well-located, clean place, with very good breakfast buffet. The bathroom and closet space are ample, but the room where I stayed was tight. I found the chairs remarkably uncomfortable, and there was no where to unpack or store a suitcase other than on the bed linen or one of the two chairs (which made them useful for something!). This boutique hotel, near all public transport, at a reasonable price, is a great choice in Berlin, but don't expect to have any space to spread out at the Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “The Happiest Man Alive Works Here!”
Reviews.Author: JamieLynne
Reviews.Content: From the perfect little breakfasts to the beautiful rooms, this hotel cannot be beat. We, two-traveling "students", have stayed in many European hotels over the past 3 months, and this one was by far, the best! The staff was incredibly accomodating; they taught us german, looked up english movie times, and greeted us happily with a smile upon each re-entry or exit. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. It's safe, it's close to the Zoo, and it's super clean. -D&J

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackieElderslie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel beside the Zoo. Ideal position for the underground and getting around. We stayed in room 16 which has a balcony overlooking the street. We had a large room with a sofa and chair. No air conditioning which would cause discomfort in the summer. The hotel is very clean with great beds. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help. Super breakfast every morning. We hired bikes from Fat Tire company around the corner. 12 euros for the day. Well worth the money got out to the Berlin forest which has nature trails and lakes. Watch out for the nudist lake. Go onto the larger lake it looks over to Spandu. The city is made for cycling with lanes for the bike on the pavement. Would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Trekkersocal
Reviews.Content: The hotel astoria is located about 200 meters from the Zoogarden Bahnhoff - the main train station in west berlin though most trains won't connect directly to here - it will take short 5 minute s-bahn ride from the main train station - hauptbanhoff in central berlin that was just completed in july 2006. The hotel staff were very accomodating, rooms were normal sized with a relatively large bathroom. No air conditioning which would make this less ideal choice in the heat of the summer - we were in berlin when temps soared to 38C making this quite unbearable - opening the windows was not helpful since we faced the courtyard otherwise you would face a busy street which was not any better. Mosquitoes were a problem on both nights we were bit about 3-4 times during the night since they did not have screens (window) on the windows. no fans as well. Recommend staying in non-summer and it'd be a great hotel with an accomodating staff. The lobby has free internet access as well. In the heat of the summer, it was miserable and for the price you pay it's a bit disappointing that at nearly 100+ euros you can't get any a/c. would recommend a higher level hotel or a larger chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Willfam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Astoria for a few days while on vacation in Berlin last August. We found the staff to be very accomodating, informative and friendly. The hotel is also in convenient walking distance to the bus station and many shops. We truly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Astoria am Kurfurstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Fasanenstrasse 2, 10623 Berlin, Germany
